info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 3:43PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Douglas and northwestern Klamath Counties through 415 PM PDT... At 341 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Highway 138 Diamond Lake Summit, or 14 miles north of Crater Lake, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Frequent lightning and up to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thielsen View Campground, Highway 138 Diamond Lake Summit, Diamond Lake, Broken Arrow Campground, Clearwater Falls Recreation Site and Digit Point Campground At Miller Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If on or near Diamond Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
